Units

Class UnitPool

  • java.lang.Object
    • Units.UnitPool

  • public class UnitPool
extends java.lang.Object
    A pool of all units in play during this game.

    • Method Summary

      Get all the units that belong to a player The key of the returned map appears to be unit type (like "LightSword")

    • Method Detail

      • getInstance

        public static UnitPool getInstance()

      • addUnit

        public void addUnit(int playerID,
           ArmyUnit unit,
           java.lang.String location)
        Adds a unit to the pool. Setting it's location to the one specified getUnitsInHex will return units added with this method.
        Parameters:
        playerID - The ID of the player
        unit - The ArmyUnit to add to the pool
        location - The location to set the unit to

      • addUnit

        public void addUnit(int playerId,
           ArmyUnit unit)
        Sets the unit's ID to player#name@hashcode Then adds it. NOTE that this will NOT index the unit by the units current position so getUnitsInHex will NOT return it. (cliff7786 - maybe this should be changed?)
        Parameters:
        playerId - The ID of the player
        unit - The ArmyUnit to add to the pool

      • addMove

        public void addMove(ArmyUnit unit,
           java.lang.String hexId)

      • getUnitsInHex

        public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> getUnitsInHex(java.lang.String hexId)
        This method will return an ArrayList of Units in the given hex. NOTE: units must have been added with the method that has location as an argument.
        Parameters:
        hexId - The Hex ID to look for units at
        Returns:
        An ArrayList of the unit IDs

      • getUnitHexMoves

        public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> getUnitHexMoves(java.lang.String unitId)

      • getAllPlayerUnits

        public java.util.TreeMap<java.lang.String,java.util.ArrayList<ArmyUnit>> getAllPlayerUnits(int playerId)
        Get all the units that belong to a player The key of the returned map appears to be unit type (like "LightSword")
        Parameters:
        playerId - The ID of the player to get units for
        Returns:
        A Map of the units

      • getSpecificPlayerUnits

        public java.util.ArrayList<ArmyUnit> getSpecificPlayerUnits(int playerId,
                                                   java.lang.String unitClassName)
        Get all the units that belong to a player of a given type (like "LightSword")
        Parameters:
        playerId - The ID of the player to get units for
        Returns:
        An ArrayList of the units

        public ArmyUnit getUnit(java.lang.String unitId)
        gets the unit with the given ID
        Parameters:
        unitId - Unit ID takes the form
        Returns:
        the unit with the given ID string, if it exists

      • clearPool

        public void clearPool()
        Empty the pool Does not empty hexList or unitMove, or hexVisited, or unitsInHex (Is this correct behavior?)
